data.title: The Tap Handle
data.solution:
Temp = float(input())
LeftDeg = float(input())
MaxTemp = float(input())
RightDeg = float(input())
MinTemp = float(input())

if Temp > MaxTemp or Temp < MinTemp:
    print("Dirty Hands!")
else:
    print(
        "%.2f" % (RightDeg + (Temp - MinTemp) / (MaxTemp - MinTemp) * (LeftDeg - RightDeg))
    )
data.statement:
You are going to wash your hands with water at the desired temperature of [[Temp]]. As you rotate the tap handle, the temperature of the water is adjusted uniformly:
• You increase the temperature if you rotate the handle counter-clockwise, with the maximum temperature of [[MaxTemp]] reached when the rotation is [[LeftDeg]] degrees.
• You decrease the temperature if you rotate the handle clockwise, with the minimum temperature of [[MinTemp]] reached when the rotation is [[RightDeg]] degrees.

Output the [[Deg]]rees of rotation of the handle that gives you water at the temperature of [[Temp]].
• If the desired [[Temp]] is greater than [[MaxTemp]] or less than [[MinTemp]], output {{Dirty Hands!}}.
data.stubGenerator:
read Temp:float
read LeftDeg:float
read MaxTemp:float
read RightDeg:float
read MinTemp:float

OUTPUT
submit now for 17% score :)

<<Line 3:>> [[MaxTemp]]: The highest temperature that you get when degrees of rotation = [[LeftDeg]]
<<Line 4:>> [[RightDeg]]: The maximum counter-clockwise rotation
<<Line 5:>> [[MinTemp]]: The lowest temperature that you get when degrees of rotation = [[RightDeg]]
All of the inputs are floats with 2 decimal places.
data.outputDescription: The degree you should rotate the handle to get the water at the temperature you want, rounded to 2 decimal places, or {{Dirty Hands!}} if you can't achieve [[Temp]]

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are going to wash your hands with water at the desired temperature of Temp. As you rotate the tap handle, the temperature of the water is adjusted uniformly:
• You increase the temperature if you rotate the handle counter-clockwise, with the maximum temperature of MaxTemp reached when the rotation is LeftDeg degrees.
• You decrease the temperature if you rotate the handle clockwise, with the minimum temperature of MinTemp reached when the rotation is RightDeg degrees.

Output the Degrees of rotation of the handle that gives you water at the temperature of Temp.
• If the desired Temp is greater than MaxTemp or less than MinTemp, output Dirty Hands!.
Input
Line 1: Temp: The desired temperature
Line 2: LeftDeg: The maximum clockwise rotation
Line 3: MaxTemp: The highest temperature that you get when degrees of rotation = LeftDeg
Line 4: RightDeg: The maximum counter-clockwise rotation
Line 5: MinTemp: The lowest temperature that you get when degrees of rotation = RightDeg
All of the inputs are floats with 2 decimal places.
Output
The degree you should rotate the handle to get the water at the temperature you want, rounded to 2 decimal places, or Dirty Hands! if you can't achieve Temp
Constraints
• LeftDeg > 0
• RightDeg < 0
Example
Input
30.00
10.00
55.00
-10.00
15.00
Output
-2.50
